Abhishek, who had been dominant against the Australian bowlers throughout the series, managed only 28 runs from 21 balls, batting well below his usual strike rate of over 200.

Cricket in LA28: ICC reveals number of teams for men's and women's events
description: Cricket will make its return to the Olympic Games at the 2028 Los Angeles Olympics, featuring both men's and women's T20 tournaments. Each division will consist of six teams competing in a total of 28 matches, with 90 athlete quotas allocated per gender. This historic inclusion marks cricket's first Olympic appearance in 128 years.

Bihar polls: Record turnout triggers guessing game — will it help or hurt Nitish?
description: Bihar's first phase saw record voter turnout, sparking debate on whether it favors the incumbent Nitish Kumar or signals anti-incumbency. Both NDA and Mahagathbandhan claim the surge benefits them. Historical trends suggest high turnout often indicates a regime change, but analysts point to recent government schemes potentially aiding the NDA.

Immigration crackdown: Canada tightens visa rules; over 5L Indian students under lens
description: Canada has updated immigration guidelines, empowering officers to cancel already-issued visitor visas, study permits, and work permits. This shift emphasizes ongoing compliance with immigration conditions, impacting international students and frequent visitors. The changes aim to strengthen oversight and prevent program misuse.

Marshawn Kneeland death: Darius Slay’s wife Jennifer shares emotional plea
description: Dallas Cowboys defensive end Marshawn Kneeland, 24, died by self-inflicted gunshot wound days after scoring his first NFL touchdown. His death followed a brief police pursuit. The tragedy has prompted widespread grief and calls for greater mental health awareness in the NFL, with many teammates and public figures sharing their sorrow and support.

title: 'Can't live with them anymore': Telangana woman kills self over fear of ants
description: A 25-year-old woman in Sangareddy district allegedly died by suicide due to a severe childhood fear of ants. She reportedly took the extreme step after noticing ants while cleaning her home. Her husband discovered her after returning from work, and a suicide note was found.

title: Ford CEO questions Apple’s CarPlay: Warns of overreach; questions Tim Cook
description: Ford CEO Jim Farley expressed strong concerns about Apple's CarPlay Ultra, fearing it encroaches too deeply into vehicle control. He questioned how far Apple's brand should extend into car functions, emphasizing the digital experience as a key differentiator for future vehicles. This follows similar reservations from other automakers and GM's decision to drop both CarPlay and Android Auto.

title: Google’s AI investment: Company may bet ‘big’ on Anthropic; equalise fight with OpenAI
description: Google is reportedly in early discussions for a major investment in Anthropic. This move escalates the global AI race, putting pressure on Microsoft-backed OpenAI. The potential funding could value Anthropic at over $350 billion. Google's strategic push aims to provide Anthropic with crucial resources to compete effectively in the evolving AI landscape.

title: Sidney Crosby future: GM Kyle Dubas makes firm call on Penguins captain
description: Pittsburgh Penguins GM Kyle Dubas has definitively stated that captain Sidney Crosby's future remains with the team. Dubas emphasized his commitment to building a contending roster around Crosby, with no plans to trade the veteran.  He believes continued success and winning are the best solutions for the team's long-term vision.

title: Gisele Bündchen says prioritizing Tom Brady took a toll: “Love isn’t a jail
description: Supermodel Gisele Bündchen, in a candid interview, shared insights into her marriage with Tom Brady, describing their split as a 'death and rebirth.' She detailed her journey of shifting from supporting her partner's career to rediscovering her own dreams and defining personal success. Bündchen emphasizes her graciousness towards Brady, highlighting her focus on authenticity and fulfillment in her new chapter.
